com.edugility.splain.io
Class MessageFactoryReader

java.lang.Object
  com.edugility.splain.io.MessageFactoryReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable
public class MessageFactoryReader
extends Object
implements Closeable

Creates MessageFactory instances from an underlying Reader.

MessageFactoryReader instances must be closed after they have been used to produce MessageFactory instances.

Author:
Laird Nelson

Method Detail

read

public <T> MessageFactory<T> read()
                       throws IOException,
                              ParseException
Reads from this MessageFactoryReader's affiliated Reader and builds a MessageFactoryReader from the results.

To avoid resource leaks, this MessageFactoryReader must be closed at some point after this method completes normally. This method does not call the close() method itself.

This method consumes a text stream whose contents are a specially formatted message catalog and loads it entirely into memory as a MessageFactory instance. The format of such a catalog is detailed below.

A message catalog consists of a list of message catalog entries separated by one or more blank lines.

A message catalog entry consists of a list of patterns, one per line, followed by a line consisting of two dashes ("--"), followed by a resource bundle key or unqualified message that those patterns notionally select.

A pattern is a textual representation of an objexj Pattern. It resembles a regular expression. Please see the objexj Syntax Guide for more information.

A resource bundle key is the name of a classpath resource identifying a ResourceBundle, followed by a solidus ("/"), followed by the name of a key within that ResourceBundle. Please see the documentation for ResourceBundleKey for more information.

An unqualified message is a simple text string that is not further processed in any way.

Line comments may be embedded in the message catalog starting with the hash sign ("#").

Because message catalog entries are processed in order, the most generic message catalog entry should be the last entry in the list. Typically it will consist of a pattern that matches Throwable and selects a generic message.

Here are some examples of message catalog entries:

# Comments like this begin with a hash sign.
# Match any Throwable chain whose root
# cause is a SQLException.  If this
# pattern matches, the corresponding message
# can be found in a ResourceBundle named "com.foo.Messages"
# under a key named
# databaseError.
java.sql.SQLException$
--
com.foo.Messages/databaseError
# Matches an IllegalArgumentException
# caused by a NullPointerException
# and selects a message named nullArgument in the
# com.foo.Messages ResourceBundle
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException/java.lang.NullPointerException
--
com.foo.Messages/nullArgument

Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects new MessageFactory instances produced from this method will work with
Returns:
a new MessageFactory; never null
Throws:
IOException - if an input or output error occurs
IllegalStateException - if parsing could not be completed
ParseException - if the source code could not be parsed

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Closes this MessageFactoryReader so that it cannot be used again. Once this method has been called, then the read() method will throw an IOException whenever it is invoked.

Specified by:
close in interface Closeable
Throws:
IOException - if an error was encountered during closing

getResourceAsStream

protected InputStream getResourceAsStream(String resourceName)
Returns a non-null InputStream that can read from a classpath resource identified by the supplied resourceName.

This implementation calls the ClassLoader.getResourceAsStream(String) method on the context ClassLoader, if that ClassLoader is non-null. Otherwise, this implementation invokes the Class.getResourceAsStream(String) method on its own Class, first ensuring that the supplied resourceName begins with a / character.

Parameters:
resourceName - the name of a classpath resource to be opened; must not be null
Returns:
a non-null, open InputStream
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if resourceName is null or identifies a resource that could not be opened
See Also:
Thread.getContextClassLoader(), ClassLoader.getResourceAsStream(String), Class.getResourceAsStream(String)
